Member Function Documentation

void Sched::Scheduler::complete_schedule ( std::vector< int > &  map_task,
PartitionSet &  realPart,
std::map< Partition, Site > &  fixed_sites 
) [protected]

Update the schedule produced by Scheduler::schedule() This method should be called by scheduler that does not verify the post condition of schedule(): each closure has to have a partition number, including closure with OCR constraint and predefined site. For some algorithm that does not consider this constraints, the partition number of closure with OCR constraint or closure with predefined site of execution are correctly setup by this method. map_task[i] points to the partition of the i-th closure in the RFO. The number of entries in map_task is the number of closures in RFO.

virtual int Sched::Scheduler::schedule ( int  requestNbPartition,
RFO::Frame *  inputFrame,
PartitionSet &  realPart,
std::map< Partition, Site > &  fixed_sites 
) [pure virtual]

This method compute a partition number for each closure in the frame. This method should be implemented in derived class in order to provide a concrete algorithm for scheduling a data flow graph. The result of the scheduling is the partition number of each closure. The scheduler should take into account the constraints of mapping closure with OCR constraint and predefined site attribut.

Parameters:
requestNbPartition [in] the request number of partitions of the graph
inputFrame [in,out] the graph to partition
[out] realPart see sched_compildfg.h in method schedule for explanation
Returns:
the number of partitions computed by the algorithm, less or equal than requestNbPartition

Implemented in Sched::DSC_Scheduler, Sched::ETF_Scheduler, Sched::METIS_Scheduler, Sched::IdentityScheduler, Sched::RandomScheduler, Sched::CyclicScheduler, and Sched::SCOTCH_Scheduler.
